decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | The approved brick screening wall 'to prevent overlooking' as shown on drawings 8CH/PP/EA/2a and 8a shall be completed before the balcony and spiral staircase are first used, and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of future occupants and in the interests of the amenity of adjoining land users.
description: Alterations to part single and two storey side extension to dwellinghouse including : insertion of garage 'up-and-over' door to front, provision of rear balcony and external staircase, provision of lantern rooflight and provision of timber privacy screen to east side of proposed balcony
